sections.body: This Act may be called the House Building Finance Corporation Act, 1952.
In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, 'Act' means the House Building Finance Corporation Act.

sections.section_title: Establishment and incorporation of the Corporation
sections.body: A Corporation to be called the House Building Finance Corporation shall be established as soon as may be to carry out the purposes of this Act.
The authorised capital of the Corporation shall be two hundred million rupees divided into forty fully paid up shares of the value of five million rupees each.
The general direction and administration of the Corporation and its affairs shall vest in a Board of Directors.

sections.section_title: Constitution and powers of the Executive Committee
sections.body: The Executive Committee shall consist of four members, that is to say, the Managing Director and three Directors to be elected by the Board.
The Managing Director shall be appointed by the Federal Government for such period and on such salary and terms and conditions of service as the Federal Government may determine.
The Board of Directors shall consist of eight Directors.
A Director shall hold office during the pleasure of the Federal Government.
No person shall be or shall continue to be a Director who is a salaried official of the Corporation other than the Managing Director.

sections.section_title: Directors absent from three consecutive meetings
sections.body: If a Director is absent from three consecutive meetings, they may be disqualified.
The Board may appoint such officers and advisers as it deems necessary.
The Chairman of the Board shall be appointed from among the Directors.
The Board may constitute a technical advisory committee.

sections.section_title: Meetings of the Board and the Committee
sections.body: The Board shall meet at least once every quarter.
Directors shall be entitled to fees for attending meetings.
The Corporation may establish regional offices.
The Corporation shall maintain a deposit account.
The Corporation may invest its funds in accordance with the provisions of this Act.
The Corporation may raise funds through various means.
Deposits may be accepted by the Corporation.

sections.section_title: Business which the Corporation may transact
sections.body: The Corporation may transact business related to house building finance.
The Corporation shall specify conditions for investments.
There shall be a limit on the amount the Corporation can invest.
Partners shall be responsible for paying fees.
The Corporation has the power to impose conditions on loans.
This section is omitted.
The Corporation shall not engage in prohibited businesses.

sections.section_title: Rights of Corporation in cases of default
sections.body: The Corporation has rights in cases of default.

sections.section_title: Power to call for payment before agreed period
sections.body: The Corporation may call for payment before the agreed period.

sections.section_title: Special provisions for enforcement of claims by the corporation
sections.body: Special provisions exist for the enforcement of claims.

sections.section_title: Act to override other laws, etc
sections.body: This Act shall override other laws.

sections.section_title: Act XVIII of 1891 to apply to the books of the Corporation
sections.body: The provisions of Act XVIII of 1891 shall apply.

sections.section_title: Maintenance of accounts and disposal of profits
sections.body: The Corporation shall maintain accounts and dispose of profits.
This section is omitted.
The accounts of the Corporation shall be audited.
The Corporation shall submit returns as required.
Provisions exist for the liquidation of the Corporation.
Directors shall be indemnified.
Directors shall declare fidelity and secrecy.

sections.section_title: Provisions relating to income-tax and super-tax
sections.body: Provisions exist regarding income-tax and super-tax.
Offences under this Act are specified.

sections.section_title: Power of Federal Government to make rules
sections.body: The Federal Government has the power to make rules.

sections.section_title: Power of the Board to make regulations
sections.body: The Board has the power to make regulations.
